article_title: Amid Cooper Union Tuition Battle, Activist Turns Trustee
article_text:
Cooper Union students seeking to stop school trustees from charging tuition have tried barricading themselves in the president’s office, leaking private school memos to the press and suing the school’s board of trustees.

But Cooper junior Devora Najjar has persuaded her activist classmates to try a new tack this semester: sharing food, drink and even a dance with the school trustees.

“People in the community don’t know the...

twitter.description: Devora Najjar, the school’s first and only student trustee, is hoping to help fellow board members reconsider the decision to charge tuition for the first time in the school’s history. Her latest plan: a student-trustee mixer.
twitter.title: Amid Cooper Union Tuition Battle, Activist Turns Trustee

image.alt: After Cooper Union’s board is sued over starting tuition, a student-trustee mixer is in the works

twitter.creator: @mikevilensky
